children.name: notifyPhoneNumber
children.text: String
children.text2: Notify phone number from which to make the call. When you initiate a call, the outgoing call workflow for the number group associated with this number runs. Ensure this workflow includes a join conference call activity to connect the user to the conference call.

children.name: Example
children.text: var from = '+14048007337'; var to = '+31646810495'; // set up call new sn_notify.NotifyScoped().call(from, to);
children.text2: This  illustrates how to initiate a call to another phone number.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: toPhoneNumber
children.text: String
children.text2: Phone number to call. Called numbers are added to the conference call.

children.name: Example
children.text: var notify = new sn_notify.NotifyScoped(); var from = '+14041234567'; var participants = ['+31612345678', '+31623456789', '+31687654321']; // set up a conference call var conferenceCall = notify.conferenceCall(); // set up the outbound calls for all conference call participants for (var i in participants) { var to = participants[i]; notify.call(from, to, conferenceCall); }
children.text2:
This  illustrates how to initiate a call to a list of telephone numbers and
        automatically join those numbers into a new conference call.

children.name: conferenceCall
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
Optional. If this parameter is passed in, the callers identified in the toPhoneNumber parameter are automatically joined into the conference call identified by this record.

GlideRecord for the Notify Call [notify_call] table which identifies the conference call record. This record is automatically added to the outgoing call workflow scratchpad as the workflow.scratchpad.conference_call variable.

children.name: userSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Unique identifier (sys_id) of the user associated with the
                call.

children.name: groupSysId
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Unique identifier (sys_id) of the group associated with the
                call.

children.name: sourceRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2: Optional. Source record that prompted this call.

children.name: call(String notifyPhoneNumber, String toPhoneNumber, GlideRecord conferenceCall, GlideRecord conferenceCallRecord, String userSysId, String groupSysId, GlideRecord sourceRecord)
children.text: Calls the specified E.164-compliant telephone number.

children.name: Example
children.text: var notify = new sn_notify.NotifyScoped(); var from = '+14041234567'; var participants = ['+31612345678', '+31623456789', '+31687654321']; // set up a conference call var conferenceCall = notify.conferenceCall(); // set up the outbound calls for all conference call participants for (var i in participants) { var to = participants[i]; notify.call(from, to, conferenceCall); }

children.name: GlideRecord
children.text: New Notify conference call [notify_conference_call] record.

children.name: sourceRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
Optional. Record that initiated the request to create the conference call. Used
                to populate the source and table fields on notify_conference_call record.

children.name: conferenceCall(GlideRecord sourceRecord)
children.text: Creates a new conference call GlideRecord.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: callRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord object on the Notify Call [notify_call] table with the held call
                you want to resume.

children.name: Example
children.text: var notifyCallGr = new GlideRecord('notify_call'); notifyCallGr.get('active participant sys id'); if (notifyCallGr.isValid) { sn_notify.NotifyScoped.dequeueCall(notifyCallGr); }
children.text2: The following  shows how to reactivate a call that was put on hold.

children.name: dequeueCall(GlideRecord callRecord)
children.text: Resumes a call after it was put in a queue (on hold).
children.text2: Use this method to resume calls that were put in a queue with the queueCall() method.

children.name: call
children.text: GlideRecord or String
children.text2:
Notify call record or the telephony provider call ID, of the call to be
                forwarded.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: Example
children.text: var callID = 'CA92374b5aa561dab476a7001db6026edc'; // Twilio Call ID var phoneNumber = '+91406xxxxxxx'; var dtmfTones = null; var notifyCallGr = new GlideRecord('notify_call'); notifyCallGr.get('active participant sys id'); if (notifyCallGr.isValid) { sn_notify.NotifyScoped.forwardCall(notifyCallGr(or) callID, phoneNumber, dtmfTones) }
children.text2: The following  shows how to forward a call to another phone number.

children.name: destination
children.text: GlideRecord or String
children.text2:
Notify phone number record or an E.164-compliant phone number, of the caller to
                which to forward the call.

children.name: dtmf
children.text: String
children.text2: Dual Tone - Multi Frequency (DTMF) code to send upon call connection.

children.name: forwardCall(GlideRecord call, String destination, String dtmf)
children.text: Forwards the specified call to a different call recipient.

children.name: notifyNumber
children.text: String
children.text2: Valid Notify phone number.

children.name: Example
children.text: var clientSessionGr = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getAvailableClients('+185xxxxxxxx'); // Here clientSessionGr is of type GlideRecord on 'notify_client_session' table. var isLoggedInUserAvailable = false; while (clientSessionGr.next()) { if (clientSessionGr.user == gs.getUserID()) isLoggedInUserAvailable = clientSessionGr.available; } gs.info('isLoggedInUserAvailable - ' + isLoggedInUserAvailable);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to use the getAvailableClients() method to index into the
        notify_client_session table and then iterate across all available Notify clients.

children.name: Array
children.text:
GlideRecord from the notify_client_session table for the specified phone number.

Returns "0" if there are no available client sessions.

children.name: getAvailableClients(String notifyNumber)
children.text: Returns a list of client sessions that are available to receive calls.

children.name: Example
children.text: // instantiate notify var notify = new sn_notify.NotifyScoped(); // get all available phone numbers var phoneNumbers = notify.getPhoneNumbers(); // iterate over phone numbers for (var i = 0; i < phoneNumbers.size(); i++) { var number = phoneNumbers.get(i); //perform any actions using each phone number }
children.text2:
This  illustrates how to obtain the Notify phone numbers and then iterate over the
        list.

children.name: List
children.text:
List of NotifyPhoneNumber objects, each object representing one phone number
                available to Notify.

children.name: getPhoneNumbers()
children.text: Returns all phone numbers and short codes available to Notify.

children.name: Example
children.text: // instantiate notify var notify = new sn_notify.NotifyScoped(); // get all available shortcodes var shortCodes = notify.getShortCodes(); // iterate over phone numbers for (var i = 0; i < shortCodes.size(); i++) { var shortCode = shortCodes.get(i); gs.log(shortCode.getNumber()); //perform any actions using each shortcode }
children.text2:
This  illustrates how to obtain the Notify short codes and then iterate over the
        list.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: getShortCodes()
children.text: Returns all short codes available to Notify.

children.name: Example
children.text: // get Notify client Tokens per active Notify driver for the currently logged in user var json = new sn_notify.NotifyScoped().getTokens(); // Parse the JSON that was return into a tokens object var tokens = JSON.parse(json); // Log line gs.log('Notify client tokens for the currently logged in user'); // iterate over the driver tokens for (var driver in tokens) { gs.log(driver + ' Driver token: ' + tokens[driver]); }
children.text2: This  shows how to obtain the client tokens for the currently logged in user.

children.name: String
children.text:
Web RTC tokens for the supported drivers, as a JSON string with the following
                format: {driverName1: “token1”, driverName2: “token2”}, such as
                "TwilioDirect":"eyJhxxxx.eyJleHAiOiIxxxx.7fejxxx_mbLxxx"

children.name: record
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord to use to identify the Notify client, such as a group record or a
                user record.

children.name: Example
children.text: // instantiate Notify var notify = new sn_notify.NotifyScoped.Notify(); // get all Notify Groups var notifyGroup = new GlideRecord("notify_group"); notifyGroup.query(); // iterate over all notify groups while (notifyGroup.next()) { // generate Notify Client tokens per active Notify Driver for this group var json = notify.getTokens(notifyGroup); var tokens = JSON.parse(json); for (var driver in tokens) { gs.log(gs.getMessage("Notify Client token for {0} driver and Notify Group '{1}': {2}", [driver, notifyGroup.getValue('name'), tokens[driver]])); } }
children.text2: This  shows how to obtain the client tokens for every Notify group.

children.name: Output
children.text: {"TwilioDirect":"eyJhxxxx.eyJleHAiOiIxxxx.7fejxxx_mbLxxx"}

children.name: Example
children.text: var notify = new sn_notify.NotifyScoped(); var now_GR = new GlideRecord('sys_user'); if (now_GR.get(gs.getUserID())) { gs.info(notify.getTokens(now_GR)); }
children.text2:
This  illustrates how to obtain the client tokens for the active telephony
        drivers.

children.name: getTokens(GlideRecord, record)
children.text:
Returns client tokens for any active telephony drivers for use in WebRTC or mobile
    clients.
children.text2: This method uses the currently logged-in user record as the client.

children.name: owner
children.text: String
children.text2:
Name of the telephony driver for which to retrieve the session length.

Valid values:

  • Twilio: for the old driver
  • TwilioDirect: for the new driver

children.name: Example
children.text: var owner = "TwilioDirect"; // Valid driver var ttl = SNC.Notify.getTokenTTL(owner); gs.info("Token TTL for " + owner + " --> " + ttl); owner = "Abcxyz"; // Invalid driver ttl = SNC.Notify.getTokenTTL(owner); // For an invalid driver, we throw NoSuchNotifyDriverException saying that Abcxyzdriver is not available // and return the default value of TTL gs.info("Token TTL for " + owner + " --> " + ttl);
children.text2:
The following  shows how to properly call this method and the associated response.
        It also shows what is returned if an invalid driver is passed.

children.name: Integer
children.text:
Maximum length of the session (in seconds).

Default: 1800 seconds

children.name: getTokenTTL(String owner)
children.text:
Returns the maximum amount of time that a client session stays active for a specified
    telephony driver before automatically timing out.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Flag that indicates whether the specified phone has the specified capability.
  • true: phone has the capability
  • false: phone does not have the capability

children.name: Example
children.text: // Each driver has a defined set of capabilities. var capability = 'show_speakers'; gs.info(sn_notify.NotifyScoped.hasCapability('+185xxxxxxxx', capability)); // true capability = 'send_sms'; gs.info(sn_notify.NotifyScoped.hasCapability('+185xxxxxxxx', capability)); // false
children.text2: This  shows how to check if a phone has a specific capability.

children.name: notifyPhoneNumber
children.text: String
children.text2: Phone number for which to check for the specified capability.

children.name: capability
children.text: String
children.text2:
Capability to detect. The string text must be an exact match to what is in the
                phone.

children.name: hasCapability(String notifyPhoneNumber, String capability)
children.text: Determines whether the specified phone number has the specified capability.
children.text2:
The telephony driver associated with the phone number contains a list of all of the capabilities of the phone.

Note: In the base system, the Notify JS driver only has 'show_speakers' as a capability; this can be modified.

children.name: participant
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord object containing the Notify Participant [notify_participant]
                record of the caller to remove from the conference call.

children.name: Example
children.text: var participant = new GlideRecord('notify_participant'); participant.get('<sys_id>'); if (participant.isValid()) { new sn_notify.NotifyScoped().kick(participant); }
children.text2: This  shows how to remove a participant from a call.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: kick(GlideRecord participant)
children.text: Removes the specified caller from the current Notify conference call.

children.name: callRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
Notify Call [notify_call] record of the call for which to apply the
                actions.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: notifyAction
children.text: NotifyAction
children.text2:
NotifyAction object describing one or more activities to perform on the
                call.

children.name: modifyCall(GlideRecord callRecord, NotifyAction notifyAction)
children.text: Performs one or more activities on an active Notify phone call.
children.text2:
Use this method to change the behavior of a call. For example, transferring a call, playing audio, or forcing a hangup.

Note: The scoped implementation of this method only supports custom Notify activities. Unlike the global implementation, it does not provide a NotifyAction API. For details on how to create a custom Notify activity, see Notify workflow activities.

children.name: participantRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord from the notify_participant table for the participant to
                mute.

children.name: Example
children.text: var notifyParticipantGr = new GlideRecord('notify_participant'); notifyParticipantGr.get('active participant sys id'); if (notifyParticipantGr.isValid) { sn_notify.NotifyScoped.mute(notifyParticipantGr); }
children.text2: The following  shows how to mute a caller.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: mute(GlideRecord participantRecord)
children.text: Mutes the specified conference call participant.

children.name: Example
children.text: var call = new GlideRecord('notify_call'); call.get('<call record sys_id>'); if (call.isValid()) { new sn_notify.NotifyScoped().queueCall(call); }

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: callRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord object of the Notify Call  record (notify_call table) to put on
                hold.

children.name: queueCall(GlideRecord callRecord)
children.text: Puts the specified call into a queue (on hold).
children.text2: Resume a queued call using the dequeueCall() method.

children.name: String
children.text: Null

children.name: Example
children.text: var incidentGr = new GlideRecord('incident'); incidentGr.get('active incident sys_id'); if (incidentGr.isValid()) { sn_notify.NotifyScoped.sendBulkSMS('+15413970605', ['+919885XXXXXX', '+919775XXXXXX'], 'Test automation message', incidentGr); }
children.text2: This  shows how to send an SMS message to multiple phone numbers (bulk SMS).

children.name: notifyPhoneNumber
children.text: NotifyPhoneNumber
children.text2: Phone number from which the SMS message is being sent.

children.name: toPhoneNumbers
children.text: String
children.text2:
Comma separated list phone numbers to which to send the SMS message.

Format: E.164-compliant

children.name: messageBody
children.text: String
children.text2: SMS text to send.

children.name: source
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2: Source record that prompted this SMS message, such as an incident.

children.name: sendBulkSMS(NotifyPhoneNumber notifyPhoneNumber, String toPhoneNumbers, String messageBody, GlideRecord source)
children.text:
Sends a specified SMS message to the specified list of Notify clients (phone
    numbers).

children.name: Example
children.text: var incidentGr = new GlideRecord('incident'); incidentGr.get('active incident sys_id'); if (incidentGr.isValid()) { sn_notify.NotifyScoped.sendSMS('+15413970605', '+919885XXXXXX', 'Test automation message', incidentGr); }
children.text2: The following  shows how to send an SMS message.

children.name: String
children.text:
Unique message SID; stored in the Notify Message [notify_message] record as
                message_id.

children.name: notifyPhoneNumber
children.text: NotifyPhoneNumber
children.text2: Notify phone number or short code to which to send this SMS message.

children.name: toPhoneNumber
children.text: String
children.text2: E.164-compliant phone number to which to send the SMS message.

children.name: messageBody
children.text: String
children.text2: SMS text message.

children.name: source
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2: Source record that prompted this SMS message, such as an incident.

children.name: sendSMS(NotifyPhoneNumber notifyPhoneNumber, String toPhoneNumber, String messageBody, GlideRecord source)
children.text: Sends an SMS text message to an E.164-compliant phone number.
children.text2: This method creates a new record on the Notify Message [notify_message] table and associates it with the source record.

children.name: Example
children.text: var notifyParticipantGr = new GlideRecord('notify_participant'); notifyParticipantGr.get('active participant sys id'); if (notifyParticipantGr.isValid) { sn_notify.NotifyScoped.unmute(notifyParticipantGr); }
children.text2: This  shows how to unmute a specified call participant.

children.name: void
children.text: Method does not return a value

children.name: participantRecord
children.text: GlideRecord
children.text2:
GlideRecord from the notify_participant table for the participant to
                unmute.

children.name: unmute(GlideRecord participantRecord)
children.text: Unmutes the specified conference call participant.

name: Notify
text: The NotifyScoped API allows you to interact with Notify calls and SMS messages using scripts.
text2: Access the scoped Notify class and its associated methods from the sn_notify namespace.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.getDialCode()); }
children.text2: This  shows how to obtain the dial code for a phone number.

children.name: String
children.text: International phone code for a country.

children.name: getDialCode()
children.text: Returns the international dialing code for a Notify phone number.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.getID()); }
children.text2: This  shows how to obtain the unique identifier for a phone number.

children.name: String
children.text: Identifier of the number within the telephony provider.

children.name: getID()
children.text: Returns the ID of this phone number as defined by the telephony provider.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.getNumber()); }
children.text2: This  shows how to obtain a Notify caller's phone number.

children.name: String
children.text: E.164-compliant phone number.

children.name: getNumber()
children.text: Returns the numerical phone number for the current Notify caller.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.getOwner()); }
children.text2:
This  shows how to obtain the telephony provide that owns the specified phone
        number.

children.name: String
children.text: Telephony provider associated with the number: Twilio.

children.name: getOwner()
children.text: Returns the telephony provider associated with this phone number.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.getTerritory()); }
children.text2: This  shows how to obtain the country of a Notify caller.

children.name: String
children.text: Name of the country to which the phone number belongs.

children.name: getTerritory()
children.text: Returns the country associated with the phone number.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.supportsConferenceCall()); }
children.text2: This  shows how to determine if a Notify caller supports conference calls.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Value that indicates whether the Notify phone number supports conference calling.
  • true: phone number does support conference calling
  • false: phone number does not support conference calling

children.name: supportsConferenceCall()
children.text: Determines if the Notify phone number supports conference calls.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.supportsIncomingPhoneCall()); }
children.text2:
This  shows how to determine if a Notify caller can receive incoming phone
        calls.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Value that indicates whether the Notify phone number supports incoming phone calls.
  • true: phone number does support incoming phone calls
  • false: phone number does not support incoming phone calls

children.name: supportsIncomingPhoneCall()
children.text: Determines if the Notify phone number supports receiving phone calls.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.supportsIncomingSMS()); }
children.text2:
This  shows how to determine if a Notify caller can receive incoming SMS
        messages.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Value that indicates whether the Notify phone number supports incoming SMS messages.
  • true: phone number does support incoming SMS messages
  • false: phone number does not support incoming SMS messages

children.name: supportsIncomingSMS()
children.text: Determines if the Notify phone number supports receiving SMS messages.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notfy.Notify.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.supportsOutgoingPhoneCall()); }
children.text2: This  shows how to determine if a Notify caller can make outgoing phone calls.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Value that indicates whether the Notify phone number supports initiating outgoing phone calls.
  • true: phone number does support initiating outgoing phone calls
  • false: phone number does not support initiating outgoing phone calls

children.name: supportsOutgoingPhoneCall()
children.text: Determines if the Notify phone number supports initiating phone calls.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.NotifyScoped.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.supportsOutgoingSMS()); }
children.text2:
This  shows how to determine if a Notify caller can initiate outgoing SMS
        messages.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Value that indicates whether the Notify phone number supports sending SMS messages.
  • true: phone number does support sending SMS messages
  • false: phone number does not support sending SMS messages

children.name: supportsOutgoingSMS()
children.text: Determines if the Notify phone number supports sending SMS messages.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.Notify.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.supportsRecording()); }
children.text2: This  shows how to determine if a Notify caller can record calls.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Value that indicates whether the Notify phone number supports recording phone calls.
  • true: phone number does support recording phone calls
  • false: phone number does not support recording phone calls

children.name: supportsRecording()
children.text: Determines if the Notify phone number supports recording phone calls.

children.name: Example
children.text: var numbers = sn_notify.Notify.getPhoneNumbers(); // Here numbers is of type List if (numbers.size() > 0) { var number = numbers.get(0); // Here number is of type NotifyPhoneNumber gs.info(number.supportsWebRTC()); }
children.text2:
This  shows how to determine if a Notify caller can initiate/accept
        browser-to-browser calls.

children.name: Boolean
children.text:
Value that indicates whether the Notify phone number supports browser-to-browser (WebRTC) calls.
  • true: phone number does support browser-to-browser (WebRTC) calls
  • false: phone number does not support browser-to-browser (WebRTC) calls

children.name: supportsWebRTC()
children.text:
Determines if the Notify phone number supports calls to a browser, such as in a WebRTC
    implementation.

name: NotifyPhoneNumber
text: The NotifyPhoneNumber API allows you to query information about a Notify phone number.
text2: Access the scoped NotifyPhoneNumber API and its associated methods in the sn_notify namespace.
